intro: Hyrtanandra hirta, commonly known as the hairy hyrtanandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Hyrtanandra hirta is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
